intro: Barleria heterotricha subsp. mutareensis, commonly known as the Mutare barleria, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its erect, branched stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, making it a suitable ornamental plant in dry, warm climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both ecological and horticultural study.
